The claim of St: Corona being the patron saint of plagues was a modern invention that started circulating in the aftermath of the COVID-19 pandemic.
Catherine M: Mooney, an expert in Church History, confirmed that St. Corona was not known as the patron saint of pandemics.
The claim lacked credible sources to sup: 4. Historical mentions of St. Corona prior to the pandemic did not connect her to pandemics, plagues, or contagious diseases.
